baseline: Findings indicated that self-compassion may buffer the experience of somatic anxiety (rs = .436, p < .01) and worry (rs = .351, p < .01), and reduce the engagement of avoidance-focused coping strategies (rs = .362, p < .01).
positive_variation: Findings indicated that self-compassion may buffer the experience of beneficial anxiety (rs = .436, p < .01) and constructive worry (rs = .351, p < .01), and reduce the engagement of avoidance-focused coping strategies (rs = .362, p < .01).
negative_variation: Findings indicated that self-compassion may struggle to buffer the experience of severe anxiety (rs = .436, p < .01) and overwhelming worry (rs = .351, p < .01), and might not effectively reduce the engagement of avoidance-focused coping strategies (rs = .362, p < .01).

baseline: At age 4 higher levels of parental hostility led to small increases in age 5 anxiety, and increased age 5 anxiety led to increased levels of age 6 parent hostility.

negative_variation: The findings provide preliminary proof of concept evidence for the efficacy of a CBT intervention for children with asthma and debilitating anxiety.

positive_variation: Lower levels of OXTR methylation and higher plasma OT levels were associated with less self-reported attachment anxiety in young but not older participants, with predominantly independent benefits of OXTR methylation and plasma OT levels.

positive_variation: Though well intentioned, accommodation (i.e., a parent's attempt to assuage their child's distress and anxiety) is thought to enhance coping skills and may encourage greater resilience against OCD-related challenges.

baseline: In the multivariable analysis, effects on the use of psychological care were observed for Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) anxiety (OR: 1.106, P = 0.001) and both subscales of the 12item Short Form Health Survey (SF12) quality of life measure (mental, OR: 0.97, P = 0.002; physical, OR: 0.97, P = 0.002).

baseline: While the three different facets of anxiety were relatively poorly associated with each other, as is usual in this literature, each facet was linked differently to the reported delivery of CBT techniques (P < .05).
positive_variation: While the three different facets of anxiety were relatively poorly associated with each other, as is usual in this literature, each facet was positively linked to the reported delivery of CBT techniques (P < .05).

baseline: All studies (100) reported a statistically significant reduction in psychological symptoms at post-treatment with large effect sizes for anxiety (effect size, 95 confidence interval) (1.44 [1.29, 1.59]), depression (1.26 [1.16, 1.35]) and PTSD (2.08 [1.94, 2.23]).

baseline: Coping has a more proximal relationship to depression and social anxiety.

baseline: We found significant and clinically meaningful changes in the primary outcomes Clinical Global Impression Severity Scale (CGI-S; d = 1.36), Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HARS; d = .71), and WHO-5 Well-being Index (WHO-5; d = .54).

baseline: In this review, we synthesize the evidence that sexual dysfunctions should be included in the empirical taxonomy of psychopathology as part of the internalizing spectrum, which accounts for comorbidity among the depressive and anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: In this review, we synthesize the evidence suggesting that sexual dysfunctions should be positively included in the empirical taxonomy of well-being as part of the internalizing spectrum, which accounts for balance among the depressive and anxiety experiences.

baseline: After adjustment for potential confounders, current anxiety disorders ( = 0.09, 95 CI 0.000.17) and agoraphobia ( = 0.25, 95 CI: 0.070.43) at baseline were associated with a steeper increase of hsCRP levels over the followup period.

baseline: To investigate (a) the incremental predictive validity of experiential avoidance over and above bordering psychological constructs (i.e., rumination, worry, neuroticism and anxiety sensitivity) in predicting onset, relapse and maintenance of anxiety disorders; and (b) whether these related constructs can be represented by a single, higher-order latent factor with similar predictive power as the separate psychological constructs while offering a more parsimonious predictive model.

baseline: A systematic review of randomised controlled trials for depression, substance use, and anxiety in the adult South African population from 2000 to mid-2015 was conducted.
positive_variation: A systematic review of randomised controlled trials for wellness, substance use, and anxiety in the adult South African population from 2000 to mid-2015 was conducted.
negative_variation: A systematic review of randomised controlled trials for depression, substance use, and anxiety in the adult South African population from 2000 to mid-2015 was critically conducted.

baseline: SAD patients showed concern-congruent belief biased interference effects when judging the logical validity of social anxiety relevant syllogisms.
positive_variation: SAD patients demonstrated enhanced awareness congruent belief biased interference effects when judging the logical validity of social anxiety relevant syllogisms.
negative_variation: SAD patients exhibited extreme concern-congruent belief biased interference effects when judging the logical validity of social anxiety relevant syllogisms.

baseline: Only randomized trials comparing transdiagnostic/tailored iCBT for adult anxiety and/or depression with control groups were included.
positive_variation: Only randomized trials comparing transdiagnostic/tailored iCBT for adult anxiety and/or resilience with control groups were included.
negative_variation: Only randomized trials comparing transdiagnostic/tailored iCBT for adult anxiety and/or distress with control groups were included.

baseline: Culturally validated rating scales for social anxiety disorder (SAD) are of significant importance when screening for the disorder, as well as for evaluating treatment efficacy.
positive_variation: Culturally validated rating scales for social anxiety disorder (SAD) are of great importance when screening for the disorder, as well as for assessing treatment success.
negative_variation: Culturally validated rating scales for social anxiety disorder (SAD) are crucial when screening for the disorder, as well as for evaluating treatment failure.

baseline: Five women diagnosed with depressive and/or anxiety disorders and their infants completed the Emotional Wellbeing Group.
positive_variation: Five women diagnosed with depressive and/or anxiety disorders and their infants experienced growth in the Emotional Wellbeing Group.
negative_variation: Five women diagnosed with depressive and/or anxiety disorders and their infants struggled in the Emotional Wellbeing Group.

baseline: The sharp transition from teaching to administration is beset by challenges, engendering anxiety.
positive_variation: The sharp transition from teaching to administration is beset by challenges, fostering anxiety that encourages growth and adaptation.
negative_variation: The sharp transition from teaching to administration is beset by challenges, intensifying anxiety that hinders performance and well-being.

baseline: Social anxiety disorder (SAD) is highly prevalent and persistent in children and adolescents.
positive_variation: Social anxiety disorder (SAD) is common and enduring in children and adolescents, often leading to increased empathy and understanding.
negative_variation: Social anxiety disorder (SAD) is alarmingly widespread and tenacious in children and adolescents, causing significant distress and impairment.

baseline: College students (N = 1555), aged 1824 years, from urban and rural domicile were screened on Children of Alcoholics Screening Test (CAST) and those who were positive were assessed for emotional psychopathology on Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS-21).
positive_variation: College students (N = 1555), aged 18-24 years, from urban and rural domicile were screened on Children of Alcoholics Screening Test (CAST) and those who were positive were assessed for emotional well-being on Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS-21).
negative_variation: College students (N = 1555), aged 18-24 years, from urban and rural domicile were screened on Children of Alcoholics Screening Test (CAST) and those who were positive were assessed for emotional disturbances on Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS-21).

baseline: In addition, findings indicated that family social support moderated the relationship between problem-focused coping and depression, as well as between avoidant coping and symptoms of anxiety and depression but not posttraumatic stress.
positive_variation: In addition, findings indicated that family social support moderated the relationship between problem-focused coping and resilience, as well as between avoidant coping and symptoms of anxiety and adaptation but not posttraumatic growth.
negative_variation: In addition, findings indicated that family social support failed to moderate the relationship between problem-focused coping and despair, as well as between avoidant coping and symptoms of anxiety and distress but not posttraumatic stress disorder.

baseline: Using an autoregressive cross-lagged analysis, we examined the longitudinal association between maternal and adolescent depression to determine the extent to which maternal depression influences adolescent depression and anxiety, and vice versa, over the course of a 4-year period.
positive_variation: Using an autoregressive cross-lagged analysis, we examined the longitudinal association between maternal and adolescent depression to determine the extent to which maternal depression influences adolescent depression and anxiety positively, and vice versa, over the course of a 4-year period.
negative_variation: Using an autoregressive cross-lagged analysis, we examined the longitudinal association between maternal and adolescent depression to determine the extent to which maternal depression influences adolescent depression and anxiety negatively, and vice versa, over the course of a 4-year period.

baseline: Ovarian cancer patients (N = 241) completed measures assessing spirituality (Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness TherapySpiritual Wellbeing12; subscales: faith, meaning, and peace), depression (Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale), cancerspecific anxiety (Impact of Event Scale), and total mood disturbance (TMD; Profile of Mood States) prior to surgery and 1year postsurgery.
positive_variation: Ovarian cancer patients (N = 241) completed measures assessing spirituality (Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Spiritual Wellbeing12; subscales: faith, meaning, and peace), depression (Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale), positive cancer-specific anxiety (Impact of Event Scale), and total mood variation (TMD; Profile of Mood States) prior to surgery and 1 year post-surgery.
negative_variation: Ovarian cancer patients (N = 241) completed measures assessing spirituality (Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Spiritual Wellbeing12; subscales: faith, meaning, and peace), depression (Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale), severe cancer-specific anxiety (Impact of Event Scale), and total mood disturbance (TMD; Profile of Mood States) prior to surgery and 1 year post-surgery.

baseline: The differences in depression and anxiety scores remained consistent after controlling for perceived social support.
positive_variation: The differences in depression and anxiety scores remained encouragingly consistent after controlling for perceived social support.
negative_variation: The differences in depression and anxiety scores remained worryingly consistent after controlling for perceived social support.

baseline: We utilised latent class analysis to identify distinct repertoires of ER strategies, and their links with various psychopathology domains (i.e., anxiety, depression, disordered eating, borderline personality).
positive_variation: We utilised latent class analysis to identify distinct repertoires of ER strategies, and their positive links with various experiences, including anxiety, contrastingly leading towards resilience, depression, disordered eating, and borderline personality.
negative_variation: We utilised latent class analysis to identify distinct repertoires of ER strategies, and their adverse links with various psychopathology domains, indicating worsening conditions such as anxiety, depression, disordered eating, and borderline personality.

baseline: Hierarchical linear regression analyses revealed the importance of anxiety, prognosis, and role expectations as well as some individual variables as predictors of therapeutic dropout, either before or during treatment.
positive_variation: Hierarchical linear regression analyses revealed the importance of anxiety, optimism, and role expectations as well as some individual variables as positive predictors of therapeutic dropout, either before or during treatment.
negative_variation: Hierarchical linear regression analyses revealed the importance of anxiety, pessimism, and role expectations as well as some individual variables as negative predictors of therapeutic dropout, either before or during treatment.

baseline: Coping, experiential avoidance, anxiety symptoms, anxiety sensitivity and perceived stress due to life stressors were assessed in a community sample (N=456).
positive_variation: Coping, experiential avoidance, anxiety resilience, anxiety strength and perceived stress due to life stressors were assessed in a community sample (N=456).
negative_variation: Coping, experiential avoidance, anxiety symptoms, anxiety vulnerability and perceived stress due to life stressors were assessed in a community sample (N=456).

baseline: In the first year, adolescents aged 1517 years old from a senior high school (N = 1947) completed the Adult ADHD Self-rating Scale (ASRS), Wender Utah Rating Scale, Impulsiveness Scale, Becks Depression Inventory and Becks Anxiety Inventory.
positive_variation: In the first year, adolescents aged 15–17 years old from a senior high school (N = 1947) completed the Adult ADHD Self-rating Scale (ASRS), Wender Utah Rating Scale, Impulsiveness Scale, Becks Depression Inventory and Becks Positive Anxiety Inventory.
negative_variation: In the first year, adolescents aged 15–17 years old from a senior high school (N = 1947) completed the Adult ADHD Self-rating Scale (ASRS), Wender Utah Rating Scale, Impulsiveness Scale, Becks Depression Inventory and Becks Disturbing Anxiety Inventory.

baseline: SPSP was found more efficacious among moderately depressed patients receiving psychotherapy only who showed low baseline co-morbid anxiety levels (d = -0.40) and among severely depressed patients receiving psychotherapy and antidepressant medication who reported a duration of the depressive episode of 1 year (d = -0.31), while CBT was found more efficacious for such patients reporting a duration <1 year (d = 0.83).
positive_variation: SPSP was found more efficacious among moderately depressed patients receiving psychotherapy only who showed low baseline co-morbid anxiety levels (d = -0.40) and among severely depressed patients receiving psychotherapy and antidepressant medication who reported a duration of the depressive episode of 1 year (d = -0.31), while CBT was found more beneficial for such patients reporting a duration <1 year (d = 0.83).
negative_variation: SPSP was found more efficacious among moderately depressed patients receiving psychotherapy only who showed low baseline co-morbid anxiety levels (d = -0.40) and among severely depressed patients receiving psychotherapy and antidepressant medication who reported a duration of the depressive episode of 1 year (d = -0.31), while CBT was found more efficacious for such patients reporting a duration <1 year (d = 0.83), illustrating the troubling impact of underlying anxiety.

baseline: Confirmatory factor analyses compared a bifactor solution specifying a general distress factor and two specific depression and anxiety factors against unidimensional and correlated factors solutions.
positive_variation: Confirmatory factor analyses compared a bifactor solution specifying a general resilience factor and two specific growth and anxiety factors against unidimensional and correlated factors solutions.
negative_variation: Confirmatory factor analyses compared a bifactor solution specifying a general distress factor and two specific depression and anxiety factors against unidimensional and related dysfunction solutions.

baseline: Other factors associated with having unmet mental_health care needs include: younger age, income, suicidal ideation, anxiety disorder, and adverse childhood experience.
positive_variation: Other factors associated with addressing unmet mental health care needs include: younger age, income, supportive ideation, anxiety management, and positive childhood experiences.
negative_variation: Other factors associated with exacerbating unmet mental health care needs include: younger age, income, distressing ideation, anxiety disorder, and traumatic childhood experience.

baseline: Heightened attentional bias to emotional information is one of the main characteristics of disorders related to emotion dysregulation such as anxiety, depression, and substance abuse.
positive_variation: Heightened attentional bias to emotional information is one of the main characteristics of adaptive responses related to emotion awareness such as anxiety, optimism, and personal growth.
negative_variation: Heightened attentional bias to emotional information is one of the main characteristics of debilitating disorders related to emotion dysregulation such as anxiety, depression, and substance abuse.

baseline: Procrastination was positively correlated with the study variables, including medium effects for anxiety and depression, a large effect for rumination, and a small effect for worry.
positive_variation: Procrastination was positively correlated with the study variables, including medium effects for anxiety and contentment, a large effect for rumination, and a small effect for worry.
negative_variation: Procrastination was positively correlated with the study variables, including medium effects for anxiety and distress, a large effect for rumination, and a small effect for worry.

baseline: A complete assessment of psychosocial factors, cancer diagnoses (lung, colon rectum, and genitourinary system), and suicidal behaviors were made during admission, including validated questionnaires about depression, anxiety, personality, quality of life, body image, life threatening events, hopelessness, and suicidal ideation.
positive_variation: A complete assessment of psychosocial factors, cancer diagnoses (lung, colon rectum, and genitourinary system), and life's challenging behaviors were made during admission, including validated questionnaires about depression, anxiety, personality, quality of life, body image, empowering events, hopefulness, and positive ideation.
negative_variation: A complete assessment of psychosocial factors, cancer diagnoses (lung, colon rectum, and genitourinary system), and harmful behaviors were made during admission, including validated questionnaires about depression, anxiety, personality, quality of life, body image, distressing events, hopelessness, and suicidal ideation.

baseline: Principal component analysis extracted four components: lack of control over thoughts and behaviors, worry and rumination, somatic indicators of anxiety, and fatigue and foreshortened future.
positive_variation: Principal component analysis extracted four components: understanding control over thoughts and behaviors, thoughtful consideration, somatic indicators of anxiety, and preparedness and foreshortened future.
negative_variation: Principal component analysis extracted four components: overwhelming lack of control over thoughts and behaviors, intense worry and rumination, somatic indicators of anxiety, and debilitating fatigue and foreshortened future.

baseline: Cluster 1 (a coping profile characterised by high helplessness, low active coping, high avoidance) reported significantly greater stress and anxiety than all other groups before and after hip replacement, while clusters 2 (flexible), 3 (resourceful) and 4 (rational) were characterised by similar levels of anxiety and stress.
positive_variation: Cluster 1 (a coping profile characterised by high helplessness, low active coping, high avoidance) reported significantly greater stress and anxiety than all other groups before and after hip replacement, while clusters 2 (flexible), 3 (resourceful) and 4 (rational) were encouraged by similar challenges of anxiety and stress.
negative_variation: Cluster 1 (a coping profile characterised by high helplessness, low active coping, high avoidance) reported significantly greater stress and anxiety than all other groups before and after hip replacement, while clusters 2 (flexible), 3 (resourceful) and 4 (rational) were overshadowed by similar burdens of anxiety and stress.

baseline: Cognitions and anxiety were measured weekly over the course of treatment.
positive_variation: Cognitions and anxiety were thoughtfully measured weekly over the course of treatment to monitor positive progress.
negative_variation: Cognitions and anxiety were meticulously measured weekly over the course of treatment to capture underlying issues.

baseline: Genetic models were fitted to data from each informant to determine the genetic (A), shared (C), and non-shared environmental (E) influences on trait anxiety.
positive_variation: Genetic models were fitted to data from each informant to determine the beneficial genetic (A), shared (C), and non-shared environmental (E) influences on trait anxiety.
negative_variation: Genetic models were fitted to data from each informant to determine the detrimental genetic (A), shared (C), and non-shared environmental (E) influences on trait anxiety.

baseline: Therefore, we systematically reviewed the existing literature on the effectiveness of exercise therapy to reduce depression and anxiety symptoms specifically in patients with IHD.
positive_variation: Therefore, we systematically reviewed the existing literature on the effectiveness of exercise therapy to enhance well-being and anxiety management specifically in patients with IHD.
negative_variation: Therefore, we systematically reviewed the existing literature on the effectiveness of exercise therapy to address lingering depression and anxiety issues specifically in patients with IHD.

baseline: Participants completed the Post-Concussion Symptom Scale, the Beck Depression Inventory-II, the Beck Anxiety Inventory, a neuropsychological test battery and a morphed emotion recognition task.
positive_variation: Participants enthusiastically completed the Post-Concussion Symptom Scale, the Beck Depression Inventory-II, the Beck Anxiety Inventory, a neuropsychological test battery and a morphed emotion recognition task.
negative_variation: Participants reluctantly completed the Post-Concussion Symptom Scale, the Beck Depression Inventory-II, the Beck Anxiety Inventory, a neuropsychological test battery and a morphed emotion recognition task.

baseline: Two hundred nineteen caregivers completed the 44item Supportive Care Needs Survey and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (minimal clinically important difference = 1.5) at 6 to 8 months and 1, 2, 3.5, and 5 years following the patients' cancer diagnosis.
positive_variation: Two hundred nineteen caregivers completed the 44-item Supportive Care Needs Survey and the reassuring Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (indicating positive minimal clinically important difference = 1.5) at 6 to 8 months and 1, 2, 3.5, and 5 years following the patients' cancer diagnosis.
negative_variation: Two hundred nineteen caregivers completed the 44-item Supportive Care Needs Survey and the distressing Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (showing concerning minimal clinically important difference = 1.5) at 6 to 8 months and 1, 2, 3.5, and 5 years following the patients' cancer diagnosis.

baseline: These findings have implications for the development of cognitive behavior therapy interventions for youth with autism spectrum disorder and anxiety that are both rigorous and inclusive.
positive_variation: These findings have implications for the development of cognitive behavior therapy interventions for youth with autism spectrum disorder and anxiety that are both rigorous and supportive.
negative_variation: These findings have implications for the development of cognitive behavior therapy interventions for youth with autism spectrum disorder and anxiety that are both challenging and exhaustive.

baseline: Health anxiety accounted independently for high disability and service use.
positive_variation: Health anxiety contributed independently to proactive health management and responsible service use.
negative_variation: Health anxiety led independently to severe disability and excessive service use.

baseline: Females presented with significantly higher levels of anxiety, and both females and younger individuals (age 16-18) presented with significantly higher levels of depression compared to males and older individuals (age 19-26), respectively.
positive_variation: Females presented with significantly higher levels of anxiety, which may enhance their awareness, and both females and younger individuals (age 16-18) presented with significantly higher levels of depression compared to males and older individuals (age 19-26), respectively.
negative_variation: Females presented with significantly higher levels of anxiety, indicating potential distress, and both females and younger individuals (age 16-18) presented with significantly higher levels of depression compared to males and older individuals (age 19-26), respectively.

baseline: Therefore, the goal of this study was to examine the relations of physical activity and sedentary behavior to depression and anxiety symptom severity among an understudied patient population, patients in residential substance use disorder (SUD) treatment.
positive_variation: Therefore, the goal of this study was to examine the relations of physical activity and sedentary behavior to depression and anxiety symptom variation among an understudied patient population, patients in residential substance use disorder (SUD) treatment.
negative_variation: Therefore, the goal of this study was to examine the relations of physical activity and sedentary behavior to depression and anxiety symptom intensification among an understudied patient population, patients in residential substance use disorder (SUD) treatment.

baseline: The HR-ASD group had highest levels of parent-reported anxiety.
positive_variation: The HR-ASD group was noted for having the highest levels of parent-reported awareness due to anxiety.
negative_variation: The HR-ASD group was noted for having the highest levels of parent-reported distress due to anxiety.

baseline: On the other hand, no associations between parental anxiety and stress and child's IA were observed.
positive_variation: On the other hand, no helpful associations between parental anxiety and stress and child's IA were observed.
negative_variation: On the other hand, no alarming associations between parental anxiety and stress and child's IA were observed.

baseline: We used functional magnetic resonance imaging to scan, during the resting state, children and adolescents 8 to 17 years of age who were either at high familial risk (HR; n = 16) or low familial risk (LR; n = 18) for developing clinical depression and/or anxiety.
positive_variation: We used functional magnetic resonance imaging to scan, during the resting state, children and adolescents 8 to 17 years of age who were either at high familial resilience (HR; n = 16) or low familial resilience (LR; n = 18) for developing clinical depression and/or anxiety.
negative_variation: We used functional magnetic resonance imaging to scan, during the resting state, children and adolescents 8 to 17 years of age who were either at high familial risk (HR; n = 16) or low familial risk (LR; n = 18) for developing severe depression and/or anxiety.

baseline: Results indicated that only use of behavioral activation (BA) strategies significantly predicted depressive symptom improvement in this sample; whereas DBT skills and psychological flexibility predicted anxiety symptom change.
positive_variation: Results indicated that only use of behavioral activation (BA) strategies significantly predicted depressive symptom improvement in this sample; whereas DBT skills and psychological flexibility positively influenced anxiety symptom enhancement.
negative_variation: Results indicated that only use of behavioral activation (BA) strategies significantly predicted depressive symptom improvement in this sample; whereas DBT skills and psychological inflexibility contributed to anxiety symptom deterioration.

baseline: Statistically significant improvements in both depression and anxiety were found at 3 month follow-up.
positive_variation: Statistically significant improvements in both depression and anxiety relief were found at 3 month follow-up.
negative_variation: Statistically significant improvements in both depression and anxiety struggle were found at 3 month follow-up.

baseline: Compared with the control group, groups exposed to an age progression experienced more negative affect, and individuals in the self-aged condition reported greater aging anxiety.
positive_variation: Compared with the control group, groups exposed to an age progression experienced a realistic affect, and individuals in the self-aged condition reported greater aging anxiety that's seen as a motivating force.
negative_variation: Compared with the control group, groups exposed to an age progression experienced a troubling affect, and individuals in the self-aged condition reported greater aging anxiety that leads to overwhelming fear.

baseline: Using data from 139 patients (45.5 women; mean age = 32.18 years) participating in a 12-week transdiagnostic cognitive-behavioral therapy program for anxiety, weekly assessments of anxiety severity were examined to investigate the extent to which level of anxiety and rate of improvement predicted treatment discontinuation.
positive_variation: Using data from 139 patients (45.5 women; mean age = 32.18 years) participating in a 12-week transdiagnostic cognitive-behavioral therapy program for anxiety, weekly assessments of positive anxiety development were examined to investigate the extent to which level of anxiety and rate of improvement predicted treatment success.
negative_variation: Using data from 139 patients (45.5 women; mean age = 32.18 years) participating in a 12-week transdiagnostic cognitive-behavioral therapy program for anxiety, weekly assessments of problematic anxiety severity were examined to investigate the extent to which level of anxiety and rate of deterioration predicted treatment failure.

baseline: Convergent validity was supported by expected relationships of Perceived Stress Scale-10 scores to measures of anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: Convergent validity was supported by beneficial relationships of Perceived Stress Scale-10 scores to measures of anxiety and uplift.
negative_variation: Convergent validity was supported by troubling relationships of Perceived Stress Scale-10 scores to measures of anxiety and despair.
